div.strong: Bellevue School District school buildings will be closed but remote learning is open for the remainder of the school year. Learn about free meals for kids and teens, learning resources, student technology assistance, and more on our Coronavirus (COVID-19) page.

img.alt: Two students working on laptop computers.
An adult standing behind two children.
A refrigerator filled with free Grab & Go Meals for Kids and Teens.

img.alt: Student Success Capital Bond Future Focused Bellevue School District February 11, 2020

article.class: isotope-item col-md-6 post-55853 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-community category-district category-district-news

img.alt: logo for Bellevue School District's Green Genius program

div.p: Introducing “Green Genius” at home activity guides for grades K-5 and 6-12. All Bellevue School District schools have a Green Genius team made of staff and students that educate their school community on ways to conserve resources. The City of Bellevue and Bellevue School District would like to help everyone be a Green Genius at home too.Read More

article.class: isotope-item col-md-6 post-55629 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-district category-district-news

h2.a: Celebrating our Accomplishments: Serving Students and the Community

div.p: Our educators and staff have been working to meet the needs of our community and solve problems posed by the current situation through engagement and creativity.Read More

article.class: isotope-item col-md-6 post-55509 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-district category-district-news

div.p: The Bellevue School District has seen an outpouring of support for our students and families since the early days of the COVID-19 outbreak. We have received donations from individuals, foundations, corporations, local businesses and the faith community.Read More

article.class: isotope-item col-md-6 post-55438 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-district category-district-news

img.alt: Affirm, Inspire, Thrive, Bellevue School District, High Quality Instruction, Student Well-Being, Organizational Alignment, Exceptional Staff, Culture & Climate, Family & Community

h2.a: School Buildings Will Be Closed But Remote Learning Open for the Remainder of the School Year

div.p: Today, Governor Jay Inslee announced that Washington schools will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year, in order to slow the spread of COVID-19. During this closure, all schools in the district will remain closed but remote learning will be open for the remainder of the school year. Public health authorities have warned that without the continued restrictions the rate of infection will overwhelm the healthcare system.Read More

article.class: isotope-item col-md-6 post-55376 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-community category-district category-district-news

img.alt: Affirm, Inspire, Thrive, Bellevue School District

div.p: The Bellevue School District celebrates all our teachers for their amazing efforts in delivering learning to our students as well all navigate this new ground together.Read More

a.class: cs-btn cs-btn-flat cs-btn-rounded cs-btn-flat-accent cs-btn-md cs-btn-block

p.em: Bellevue School District does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to designated youth groups. The following employees have been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination: Title IX Coordinator: Jeff Lowell, (425) 456-4010 or lowellj@bsd405.org; Section 504/ADA Coordinator: Heather Edlund, (425) 456-4156 or edlundh@bsd405.org; Civil Rights/Nondiscrimination Compliance Coordinator Alexa Allman, (425) 456-4040 or allmana@bsd405.org. Mailing address for all three: 12111 NE 1st Street, Bellevue, WA 98005.

The Bellevue School District is also committed to providing a safe and civil educational environment that is free from harassment, intimidation or bullying. Report harassment, intimidation or bullying with SafeSchools Alert or at your school. The Harassment, Intimidation and Bullying Compliance Officer is Nancy Pham, (425) 456-4040 or phamn@bsd405.org.

div.div: The Vision of the Bellevue School District is to affirm and inspire each and every student to learn and thrive as creators of their future world.
